intro: Visenia madagascarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar ash tree, is a deciduous tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and compound leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange or red fruits that split open to release seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its unique ecological role, it is considered a valuable species for conservation efforts.
